channel.title: Publications on Moo! - Michiel van der Meer
channel.description: Recent content in Publications on Moo! - Michiel van der Meer

item.title: Learning to Ask Timely Questions in a Collaborative Grounded Language Understanding Task
item.description: Artificial agents benefit from asking questions to human instructors at the right time, can predictive uncertainty be used to find the right time? Joint work with my colleagues from Hybrid Intelligence: Kata Naszadi, Taewoon Kim, Putra Manggala. Link to the two-page abstract: here.

item.title: What Values Should an Agent Align with?
HyEnA: A Hybrid Method for Extracting Arguments from Opinions
item.description: My work on extracting arguments from an opinion corpus using a hybrid (human + AI) approach. Link to the paper: here How to cite Supplementary material Description and additional results: Includes a richer description of the HyEnA experiments, including inter-rater reliability (IRR) metrics, the full key argument lists and details on the implementation of the baselines. Code and data: contains all data and code used in the analysis experiments for HyEnA.

item.title: Reason Against the Machine: Future Directions for Mass Online Deliberation
item.description: Review paper on the design elements in deliberation platforms. Link to the paper: here.

item.title: A Collaborative Platform for Identifying Context-Specific Values
Axies: Identifying and Evaluating Context-Specific Values
Hunting a Robot Controlled by an Artificial Brain
The Roasted Tomato Challenge for a Humanoid Robot
Exploiting Language Instructions for Interpretable and Compositional Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Attempt to interpret the latent space from an RL agent to identify its current objective in a complex language instruction. This work followed my master thesis at the UvA. Link to the paper: here.
